meanings.definition: To change the color of something.
meanings.sent1: I will recolour my room walls this weekend.
meanings.sent2: She decided to recolour her old dress to make it look new.
meanings.sent3: The artist tried to recolour the sky purple, but it turned out pink!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to recolour the dull room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The magic wand could recolour anything it touched into a rainbow of hues.

meanings.definition: To give a new color to something.
meanings.sent1: He plans to recolour his bike to match his new helmet.
meanings.sent2: The painter will recolour the fence to freshen up the garden.
meanings.sent3: The chef wanted to recolour the cake blue, but it ended up green!
meanings.sent4: Her words had the power to recolour his world with hope.
meanings.sent5: The sunset seemed to recolour the sky with shades of orange and pink.
